text:
Hi,
	We are using Tomcat 4.1.18 and the Tomcat Database connection pooling 
mechanism. Unfortunately it looks like there is no way by which I can explictly 
state that abandoned connections should be instantly killed OR recycled as soon 
as the time out is reached. 

thanx,

Srikanth. S.
creator: srikanth_s_india@hotmail.com

text:
The DBCP recycles abandoned connections when it starts running out of
room in the connection pool.  That is the way it is designed.

The DBCP is part of Jakarta commons.  If you still need this feature
file a new bug report listing it as an Enhancement for the DBCP in
Jakarta Commons.
creator: glenn@apache.org
